purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of Justification.

Justification represents the identification and description of the reasons for something. Justifications may be associated with the data to which they apply as well as supporting evidential data for the justifications. For example: a justification may be provided for a product design. Similarly, a justification may be provided for why an activity is needed or was undertaken.
The reason for something may be based on an assumption, that is something assumed to be true without proof.
The second edition of this part of ISO 10303 incorporates the modifications to the first edition listed below.
The following ARM EXPRESS declarations and interface specifications have been added:
In addition, modifications have been made to the mapping specification, the MIM schema and the EXPRESS-G diagrams to reflect and be consistent with the modifications of the ARM.

inscope.li: the provision of one or more justifications for something;
the specification and identification of what is being justified and in what context;
the specification of relationships between justifications;
the association of the justification to the supporting evidential data on which it is based.

outscope.li: the data items for which the justification is provided;
the supporting evidential data items on which the justification is based;
the association of general management data, such as the assignment of classifications, date or time, and person or organization, to the justification.
